content.description: Follow fun, low angle fins up and left mostly 5.6, then top out the right headwall.
content.protection:
A single set, heavy on finger pieces. Look for threads and horns. Place gear in pockets on better rock, and a nut tool is helpful for the deep threads.... Unique. Build an anchor just over the headwall with medium stoppers and small cams.

Per

Spencer Cone

: there are 8 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor.

content.description:
White Trash is a short and bouldery route uphill from the Triangle Boulder and The Cube.  Nolan Robertson might downgrade it to 11c, but what he won't tell you is that he didn't onsight it.  Enjoy this route in a circuit with

Moon Boi

, and then hit the boulders!
content.protection: 5 bolts and a 2 bolt anchor - 7 draws total.
content.location:
Go uphill from Triangle Boulder (Something Wicked) or walk past

Moon Boi

(on The Cube) and go uphill.

climbs.name: Thread
climbs.fa: Clint Casey? but most likely climbed by San Juan College almost 20 yrs ago

content.description: Follow a black streak and tufa up and left. Once you are about 20' below the top, cut right, and top out on the steep headwall.
content.protection: Lots of cool threads and a single set heavy on finger sizes. Place gear in pockets on better rock, and a nut tool is helpful for the deep threads.... Unique.
content.location:
Start behind 3 big oak trees about 15' left of

Wrinkle

.

content.description: Go up the right-angled crack. A cruxy start leads to a lieback/heelhook. You then get some texture to cruise the middle. Another crux near the top involves fist jams and shit compression. It's a party.
content.protection: TR from the bolt anchor of the sport route to the right.
content.location: It is in the North corridor of the Cube, between the two sport routes.

content.description: NIMBY has thin and balancy climbing on near vertical rock.
content.protection: Bolts and anchors with Mussy hooks.
content.location: It is in the middle of the shady northwest corridor.

content.description: Moon Boi is a short, technical, slightly overhanging sport route on The Cube. The 1st bolt can be clipped by stemming from the boulder behind. Expect powerful crimping, gaston, and sloper moves going up the mini-corner system, with less-than-ideal footholds and pumper moves all the way to the anchor.
content.location: Located in the north-facing corridor of The Cube, Moon Boi is about 20 feet up the corridor from the northwest corner of the Cube.

content.description:
This route is on the left side of the SE face of The Cube.

Start on very high quality rock with amazingly fun slab climbing using sidepull fins, then pull through a small "roof" before gaining a left-trending ledge. From the ledge, continue up jugs to mantel onto more fins, and then trend up and left towards the anchors. Just follow the bolt holes!
content.protection:
TR or removeable bolts, I guess. I'm assuming the route kind of sucks to TR after the bolts were removed as the climb wasn't exactly plumbline from the anchors. I WOULD NOT recommend gear on this one due to the runout/bad fall potential at the top (crux).

Per

Spencer Cone

: as of April 2020, there are 5 bolts & an anchor.

content.description: Start on the left side of the slab. Some good dirty moves bring you up to a left-facing flake, and follow the flake up into the void. Your palms then get you to the top. Traverse right to the anchor.
content.protection:
This shares an anchor with the bolted routes on the slab.

Per

Spencer Cone

: there are bolts and an anchor now.
content.location: It is on the left side of the NE slab.
